IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: To provide facilities, services and programs to enhance the quality of life for older persons.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The mission of Virginia United Methodist Homes, Inc. (VUMH) is to provide facilities, services and programs to enhance the quality of life for older persons.
IRS990.Description: VUMH provides for the housing, health care and financial security needs of aged persons at its five continuing care retirement communities and one assisted living facility in Virginia. VUMH is also the sole member of Virginia United Methodist Homes of Williamsburg, Inc., which owns and operates a continuing care retirement community in Williamsburg, Virginia. Each of these residential communities provides for the physical, emotional, recreational, social and religious needs of the elderly through specialized programs. These communities serve a diverse range of residents with excellent, compassionate care in a Christian environment. VUMH provides (directly and through third-party arrangements) for the health care of the elderly through skilled nursing care, assistance with activities of daily living, memory (including dementia and Alzheimer's) care, physical therapy and related health care services. VUMH is committed to providing for the financial security of its residents in compliance with the standards applicable to a public charity. Consistent with this commitment, VUMH has established the Samaritan Program, through which funds are solicited by various means on behalf of residents who may become unable to pay a portion or all of their expenses, including direct solicitation of members of the United Methodist Church.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Organization maintains deposits for prospective residents until they are accepted for residency in the community.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The income from VUMH's permanently restricted endowment fund is dedicated to provide monies to defray the cost of housing and services to persons in VUMH communities who are unable to provide such monies on their own behalf.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Consistent with the organization's By-laws and VUMH Audit Committee Guidelines, a copy of the Form 990 was presented to the VUMH Audit Committee, as well as all members of its Governing Board, and was approved by the Board prior to its filing.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: All Board members annually sign a sworn disclosure statement. The information stated in the sworn disclosure statement is included in the Annual Disclosure Statement filed with the State Corporation Commission of Virginia by September 30 of each year.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: VUMH uses an HR consultant to compare VUMH positions to like positions in the market. The market analysis methodology defines the marketplace based on compensation philosophy (I.E. continuing care retirement communities, health care, hospitality and non-profits). The regional market includes metro areas, Virginia statewide and South Atlantic states. Market data is collected from numerous surveys.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: VUMH's Articles of Incorporation are on file with the State Corporation Commission of Virginia and available to the public on request. VUMH's conflict of interest policy is available to the public upon written request. VUMH's audited financial statements are included in its annual Disclosure Statement filed with the State Corporation Commission of Virginia. That Disclosure Statement is made available to all VUMH residents and to the public upon request. In addition, VUMH's financial information is made available to the public on GUIDESTAR.ORG.

The processes involving the oversight of the Organization's audit of their financial statements and selection of the independent accountant engaged for this audit have not changed from the prior year.
